metadata.Title: CVE-2022-28805 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
singlevar in lparser.c in Lua from (including) 5.4.0 up to (excluding) 5.4.4 lacks a certain luaK_exp2anyregup call, leading to a heap-based buffer over-read that might affect a system that compiles untrusted Lua code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28805` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblua5.4-0 - 5.4.4-3
lua5.4 - 5.4.4-3
No subscription required

notes.Note: iconstantin> debian bug #1010265 mentions related code is introduced in 5.4

criterions.comment: lua5.4 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.4-3').
